item.title: Oil Falls Despite Geopolitical Tensions
item.description: Oil prices traded 0.5% lower in Europe as concerns over the macroeconomic outlook and global oil demand offset the impact of geopolitical tensions in Russia and the Middle East.

item.title: Hong Kong Shares Drop 2.3%; Hang Seng Properties Index at 15-Year Low
item.description: The Hang Seng fell 2.3%, dragged by property, consumer-product and technology stocks, with the Hang Seng Properties Index closing at its lowest since March 2009.

item.title: FDJ Agrees to $2.7 Billion Deal for Kindred Group
item.description: The deal would create one of Europe’s biggest online gambling companies.

item.title: U.S. Rate Cuts Will Be Negative for Dollar
item.description: Standard Chartered said sharp interest-rate cuts by the Fed would be negative for the dollar, but the currency could also fall on moderate easing.

item.title: Ten-Year BTP-Bund Spread Has Scope to Narrow, Says Citi Research
item.description: Citi Research is turning more positive on Italian government bond spreads, expecting the 10-year BTP-Bund spread to continue to tighten toward 140-150 basis points, unless fundamentals are brought into play by any downside data surprises.

item.title: Sony Group to Ax Merger Between India Unit and Zee Entertainment
item.description: Sony Group is terminating the planned merger of its Indian unit and Mumbai-based media company Zee Entertainment Enterprises after certain conditions went unmet.

item.title: A Secretive Chinese Force Is Becoming the U.S. Military's Biggest Challenge
item.description: A secretive Chinese military unit has tested hundreds of missiles and developed weapons capable of evading U.S. defenses. China’s Rocket Force has built one of the largest missile forces in the world, in preparation for a possible invasion of Taiwan.

item.title: Exxon sued two sustainable-investment firms in a bid to block them from putting forward a shareholder proposal that would commit the oil company to further curb its greenhouse-gas emissions and target its customers' emissions.
item.description: Exxon sued two sustainable-investment firms in a bid to block them from putting forward a shareholder proposal that would commit the oil company to further curb its greenhouse-gas emissions and target its customers’ emissions.

item.title: Citigroup is exiting the $4 trillion municipal-bond market early this year after a quarter-century as a top trader of U.S. state and local government debt.
item.description: Citigroup is exiting the $4 trillion municipal-bond market early this year after a quarter-century as a top trader of U.S. state and local government debt.

item.title: Target, Nike, and REI all complained to city officials about crime in Portland, Ore., and sought help before announcing plans to close stores in the city in 2023, email correspondence viewed by The Wall Street Journal shows.
item.description: Target, Nike, and REI all complained to city officials about crime in Portland, Ore., and sought help before announcing plans to close stores in the city in 2023, email correspondence viewed by The Wall Street Journal shows.

item.title: An investor that lodged a $5.8 billion bid to acquire Macy's threatened to bring the matter to shareholders as the famed department-store chain said it had rejected the offer.
item.description: An investor that lodged a $5.8 billion bid to acquire Macy’s threatened to bring the matter to shareholders as the famed department-store chain said it had rejected the offer.

item.title: After a door-plug blowout on an Alaska Airlines flight, Boeing faces new concerns that added inspections and regulatory scrutiny will sap its output this year.
item.description: After a door-plug blowout on an Alaska Airlines flight, Boeing faces new concerns that added inspections and regulatory scrutiny will sap its output this year.

item.title: Archer Daniels Midland placed its chief financial officer on administrative leave as it investigates accounting practices centering around its nutrition business.
item.description: Archer Daniels Midland placed its chief financial officer on administrative leave as it investigates accounting practices centering around its nutrition business.

item.title: Chinese electric-vehicle maker BYD is moving into the luxury market, having overtaken Tesla in overall EV sales with a range of affordable cars.
item.description: Chinese electric-vehicle maker BYD is moving into the luxury market, having overtaken Tesla in overall EV sales with a range of affordable cars.

item.title: What's News: Business & Finance
item.description: What’s News: Business & Finance

item.title: More Americans than ever owe past-due taxes, some because IRS collection efforts were put on hold during the pandemic, which reduced the number of taxpayers paying balances.
item.description: More Americans than ever owe past-due taxes, some because IRS collection efforts were put on hold during the pandemic, which reduced the number of taxpayers paying balances.

item.title: Ukraine hit a Russian fuel terminal on the Baltic Sea, one of its longest-range strikes yet in a growing effort to damage Russia's war economy.
item.description: Ukraine hit a Russian fuel terminal on the Baltic Sea, one of its longest-range strikes yet in a growing effort to damage Russia’s war economy.

item.title: The IRS is struggling to sort legitimate claims from bogus ones for the pandemic-era employee-retention tax credit, with many claims that arrived last summer considered particularly suspect.
item.description: The IRS is struggling to sort legitimate claims from bogus ones for the pandemic-era employee-retention tax credit, with many claims that arrived last summer considered particularly suspect.

item.title: DeSantis ended his presidential bid, a crushing defeat for a figure who once represented the strongest hope for Republicans wanting to move past Trump but one who misread the former president's durability, overestimated his own political skill and struggled through reboot after reboot.
item.description: DeSantis ended his presidential bid, a crushing defeat for a figure who once represented the strongest hope for Republicans wanting to move past Trump but one who misread the former president’s durability, overestimated his own political skill and struggled through reboot after reboot.

item.title: Disagreements between Biden and Netanyahu over the possibility of establishing a Palestinian state after Israel's war with Hamas have spilled into public view, threatening to create a deeper rift between Israel and its biggest ally.
item.description: Disagreements between Biden and Netanyahu over the possibility of establishing a Palestinian state after Israel’s war with Hamas have spilled into public view, threatening to create a deeper rift between Israel and its biggest ally.
